title: Establishing Normality Based on the $5$-Number Summary
question_text: The $5$ -number summary for a certain distribution is as follows: $$28$$ $$53$$ $$75$$ $$97$$ $$122$$ The mean of the distribution is $75.10$ and the standard deviation is $31.27$ .  Assume $n\ge 100$ . Based upon this information, is the distribution approximately normal?  Why or why not?

choices.text: Yes, because the Q 3 Q 3 value and Q 1 Q 1 value are equally far from the median, and the median is approximately equal to the mean.
Yes, because the values in the 5 5 -number summary are completely symmetric around the mean.
Yes, because approximately 50 % 50 % of the data falls within one standard deviation of the mean.  This is what would be expected in a normal distribution.
No, because 100 % 100 % of the data falls within 2 2 standard deviations of the mean.  In a normal distribution, the spread of data would be greater.
No, because the data contains a high outlier.  In a normal distribution, no outliers would be present.
